snippet: The report comes as a soldier and a civilian were shot and killed in Caracas during an extended confrontation between residents, government supporters and troops.
abstract: United Nations human rights experts voice concern over reports of excessive use of force against Venezuelan protesters and journalists during wave of antigovernment demonstrations across country; statement comes as a soldier and a civilian are shot and killed in Caracas in confrontation between residents, government supporters and troops, bringing death toll to 21 since mid-February.
lead_paragraph: The report comes as a soldier and a civilian were shot and killed in Caracas during an extended confrontation between residents, government supporters and troops.

headline.main: U.N. Voices Concern Over Reports of Excessive Force in Venezuela
headline.print_headline: U.N. Voices Worry Over Reports of Excessive Force in Venezuela

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
